alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 7:45PM CDT until May 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of McLennan County in Central Texas * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Loop 340 and portions of Hwy 6 have received excessive rainfall and may experience localized flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Robinson, Bellmead, Lacy-Lakeview, Beverly Hills, Hallsburg and Northcrest.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
